heading: ebay profits amid booming traffic
subheading: ebay reports a profit despite escalating expenses in the third quarter, while registered users and auctions have skyrocketed in number.
author: reuters
text: the popular online auction site ebay tuesday reported a modest third quarter profit as well as a sharp increase in sales and several other measures of traffic to its site. however the company also reported that expenses were growing rapidly, and its stock price fell sharply in after-market trading after the earnings were announced. the stock, which had risen 1 to 152 a share in the regular session, was down as much as 9 a share in early after-hours trading.ebay reported net income in the third quarter of us$1.4 million or one cent per diluted share, compared with a profit of $461,000 or nil per share in the year-ago quarter. excluding certain unusual charges, the company said it earned $3.2 million or two cents per diluted share, a penny more than most analysts had forecast.revenues almost tripled, to $58.5 million from $21.7 million in the year-ago quarter. the company said its number of registered users increased to 7.7 million at the end of the quarter, compared with 1.3 million the year before, and it hosted 36.2 million auctions, compared with 9.2 million the year before.gross merchandise sales, or the value of goods traded on the ebay site, totaled $741 million, compared with $195 million last year.in addition, ebay reported a large increase in its expenses, which actually grew faster than revenues in the latest quarter.the company said total operating expenses were $46.2 million in the latest quarter, compared with $15.5 million last year.in a statement, the company said it made significant investments in personnel, contractors, and equipment to support its infrastructure. it said personnel and contractor costs were the largest single contributor to the increase in operating expenses during the quarter, and that sales and marketing expenses increased due to increased online advertising costs.copyright
